body_html: Typo. 600+ MB which is still a lot. Ok to run it in the beginning, when not everything is allocated, might not want to do it later. As for performance penalty, it's ok for bigger networks (for 2-layer, 1536 hiddenSize, 35 seqLength, and I don't exactly remember batch size that I ran yesterday, LSTM itself was ~ 170 ms on Titan X, random initialization is 2 ms), worse for small ones, especially on wide and fast GPUs, like P100. At the very least, setDropoutDescriptor should not be called if dropout=0.
